question_list.author: Celia Warren
question_list.text:
Oh, don't throw your toys out your pram!
Yes, I treat all your emails as spam.
Hurt your feelings? Don't care;
I don't like you, so there!
Just accept that I don't give a damn!
question_list.question: Why do I treat all your emails as spam?

question_list.author: MikeAq
question_list.text:
To compose a morose epicedium
Can brighten one's torpor and tedium.
I myself have an urge
To create a sad dirge —
One not overly mournful, just medium.
question_list.question: How can one brighten one's torpor and tedium?

question_list.author: neilski
question_list.text:
Dear fans, re the letters you write:
Peace and love, but I'm losing the fight.
From October, I'm sure,
They'll be answered no more:
I've no time. Peace and love, and goodnight.
question_list.question: From October, what will be answered no more?

question_list.author: MikeAq
question_list.text:
Mr. Thistle, what's this all about?
All our rules you dismiss — baldly flout.
I have read your epistle;
It made my hairs bristle.
I'm blowing the whistle — you're out!
question_list.question: Does Mr. Thistle follow our rules?

question_list.author: Richard English
question_list.text:
Some folks might think cranberry glass
Is for fruit of the cranberry class.
But it's glass of deep red,
With a gold sheen, and said
To be sought by the English top brass.
question_list.question: What is sought by the English top brass?

limerick_list.author: psheil
limerick_list.text:
When I'm out shooting grouse with the Queen
We are hidden; by grouse we're not seen.
Just a low wall will do
For this butt made for two
Out of stone, or of turf that is green.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though I don't accept Mazda or Zeus,
Or any god, that's no excuse
(Yes, my creed's atheistic,
And I shun all that's mystic)
For subjecting my views to abuse.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though the beatings Sarge gives are severe,
There's one fact that is perfectly clear:
Beetle Bailey's whole cast
All exist in my past.
I knew each in my Air Force career.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The brattice: a structure you'll find
In the places where iron is mined.
When correct indications
Exist, ventilation's
Controlled when the planks are aligned.

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
When those CME credits are due,
And you still need to gain quite a few,
It might take an all-nighter
To make things seem brighter
And all of those credits accrue.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A counterdeployment is planned;
We have seven battalions on hand.
This impressive array
Is a way to convey
To our foes that we won't be outmanned!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An apothesis isn't a theory,
Or a deification. (How cheery!)
It's a room off the path
In a large public bath,
Or some shelves near a chancel. (How dreary!)

limerick_list.author: Jesse Law
limerick_list.text:
I could synthesize lipids all day,
But that acetyl coenzyme A
Is a substance I lack.
Now Krebs' cycle's off track:
Mitochondria in disarray.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Though the fugitive seems extraditable,
The public is roused and excitable.
"He won't get a fair trial,"
They protest, rebel-style,
And I fear a revolt is ignitable.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Let's call in a bulwark installer
To make our stone ramparts still taller,
For the waves are immense,
And without more defence
Our small island will keep getting smaller.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"You're a bubblehead!" That's what he called me;
I'll admit that the insult appalled me.
Though I totaled his car
As I drove through Joe's Bar,
Did he have to get angry? That galled me!

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
Now, old bean, please discuss flageolet.
"It's a kidney-shaped haricot, pet,
And to boot, it's a flute
One can toot. There's one root
For this word with two meanings, I'd bet."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Made of corn? It's our favorite muffin,
So I wonder—is Muffy just bluffin'?
Has our tough southern cousin
Just baked us a dozen?
If so, soon our mouths we'll be stuffin'.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A coral, named Carol, related
How the amorphozoa she dated
Made profound social blunders,
Were all gutless wonders,
And sponged all her cash, which she hated.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
It's a game that my eighth graders played:
I'd ask, "What's a good word for decayed?"
The response I have cherished
For years is "emperished,"
Which a budding young linguist once made.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
Father John is no friend of great shows.
They're expected in church though, he knows:
His externalist parish
Likes the pompous and garish,
So for Heaven's sake anything goes.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To do craftwork, you'd best understand
You must make every item by hand,
But the craftwork produced
Gives your ego a boost
As your fame and your fortune expand.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
This front porch campaign, new-created,
Was effective and, yes, underrated.
He'd prevail in a breeze,
Self-assured and at ease:
He stayed home, issued statements, and waited.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
As the goyim in Glasgow might say,
"I am fated to die — yes, I'm fey".
Now my Barry will marry
A shiksa named Carrie;
For me, the end's nearing. Oy vey!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
His state of annoyance, or peevage,
Was suddenly changed to quivivage
When he saw that young Nellie,
South of throat, north of belly,
Showed the valley (V-shaped) of her cleavage.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
For my verse, you're a callous mortician:
You've depoetized every submission.
An original trope
In your hands has no hope,
And is butchered beyond recognition.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Death camases give me the willies.
They look like some edible "lilies,"
But their bulbs, leaves and flowers
Can kill you in hours,
Whether you stands for ewes, cows or fillies.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
This wine-tasting party's too tame
For the godhead of oenophile fame,
'Til it turned orgiastic;
A feast so fantastic
Deserved Dionysus's name.

limerick_list.author: StephenGold
limerick_list.text:
There's a conclave about to begin;
See the Cardinals, gathered within.
Each has conclavists, two,
For assistance. Do you
Think they're privy to cardinal sin?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To pour out, much more quickly than "ooze"?
There, the word that I'd use is effuse,
But for "scattered, spread loose,"
There my choice is effuse.
Such distinctions can greatly amuse.

limerick_list.author: Taillefer
limerick_list.text:
The concepts I lodged in my book
Are beliefs that from others I took.
They wanted them spread
But were scared to embed
Them in theirs. Does this make me a crook?

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
If you live in the water while young
Then develop an air-breathing lung,
You're amphibiotic,
Which ain't idiotic,
At least if it's frogs you're among.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
"Lady, listen: I can book a crew,
But the wait is a week—maybe two.
We can concrete your drive,
But it won't be by five.
Still, your drive'll be smooth when we're through."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
An earnest old man (not some stoner)
Called me up to announce, "I'm the owner
Of knives that you sell
And I like them real well.
What I need now's a seven-inch boner."

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Colonel Blimp, from a thirties cartoon,
Was an ultraconservative goon.
To be blimpish, indeed,
Means to hold such a creed
(Or resemble a bulging balloon).

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Did cryptorchism trouble Hephaestus?
He worked next to fire, so each testis
Got hot. Did he tote 'em
Way down in his scrotum,
With underpants made of asbestos?

limerick_list.author: danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
This is you if you hew to the view
That we've screwed up the world that we knew.
There can be no repair.
Buy a gun, say a prayer.
Clearly chaos is coming.  We're  through!

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
I was tied to the rack and held fast.
"You'll confess to the sins of your past,"
My inquisitor said,
"Or we'll cut off your head,
But acknow, for this offer won't last!"

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
When American Bandstand debuted
What's the first song the disc jockey queued?
Lots of noise kids were makin'
'Cause a whole lot of shakin'
Was goin' on thanks to this dude.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
As our priest made the case for salvation,
His passions arose; escalation
Of tone and intensity
Increased my propensity
To escalate Sunday's donation.

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
